721735f.title: Manhattan: Morton Street - Hudson Street
721735f.text:
Georgian doorway, rated the aost beautiful in New
York, at 59 Morton Street, built by A.T. Stewart, on the
north side of Morton, east of Hudson Street.
About 1918
New York Sun Staff Photograph
Gift of E. M. Jenks
721735f.folder: Morton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

733361f-b.title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.34-36.
733361f-b.text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 34, at the N.E. corner of
Hudson Street and St. Luke's Place (Leroy Street in the block
east of Hudson).
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 35. An intropid vaoguero and his big sister, at (27
Hudson Street, between Leroy and Morton Streets. The east
side of Hudson Street, at Morton, is shown in the background.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 36. A group of urchins on the S.W. corner of Hudson and
Morton Streets.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
733361f-b.folder: Hudson Street and Morton Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

720546f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Morton Street
720546f-a.text:
Hudson Strect, west side, south from, but not including Morton Street.
A1so shown is Leroy Street,(across clearance) at the S.W. corner of Hudson
Street.
March 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
720546f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Morton Street, Manhattan, NY

721736f-b.title: Manhattan: Morton Street - Hudson Street
721736f-b.text:
(1)
Morton Street, east from Hudson Street, showing the bend which
marks the eastern end of the original M:orton Street and the
western end of the former Ardens Strect, a much narrower
Street which was amalgamated with Morton Street in 1829.
The 1ittle gap between Nos. 46 and 44, where the bend occurs
on the south side of the street, exactly marks the eastern
boundary line of the old Trinity Church Farm. No. 44 is a
three-story house adjoining the three five-story tenements
42-40-38 Morton Street.
June 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A similar view three years later, but not including Hudson
Street. Nos. ol and 59 are the two small houses on the north
side adjoinang a new apartment building, which is only slightly
visible here, at 438 Hudson Street on the N.E. corner (and in-
cluding o7-63 Morton Street).
April 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
O 70  NV2: 2:0, E4g8N N
-C  gN 24r1eE.

721737f-a.title: Manhattan: Morton Street - Hudson Street
721737f-a.text:
(1)
Morton Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Hudson
Street, as seen across clearance on the west sidoo of Hudson Street. Also
shown (right side), is Hudson Street, east side, north from Morton Strset.
March 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, and showing a more extensive view of Hudson Street.
March 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
